sentences.en: A dentist may decide to extract the tooth to prevent recurrent trouble.
sentences.cn: 牙医可能会决定拔掉那颗牙，以免反复发作。

sentences.en: horror stories about visits to the dentist
sentences.cn: 有关看牙医的种种吓人说法

sentences.en: I had to have two fillings at the dentist's today.
sentences.cn: 我今天不得不在牙科诊所补了两颗牙。

sentences.en: I have got toothache, so I must go to a dentist.
sentences.cn: 我牙疼, 必须去看牙医.

sentences.en: I must ask the dentist to fit me with some new teeth.
sentences.cn: 我必须请牙医给我镶几颗新牙.

sentences.en: I picked up a free booklet on tooth care at the dentist's.
sentences.cn: 我在牙医那里拿了一本关于牙齿保健的免费小册子.

sentences.en: I went to my dentist to have a tooth taken out.
sentences.cn: 我去找牙医拔了一颗牙.

sentences.en: I've just had a tooth out at the dentist's.
sentences.cn: 我刚在牙科诊所拔了一颗牙。

sentences.en: It's worse than being at the dentist's.
sentences.cn: 这比呆在牙科诊所里还要糟糕。

sentences.en: She cried out with pain when the dentist pulled her tooth out.
sentences.cn: 牙医拔牙时她痛得喊叫起来.

sentences.en: She made periodical visits to her dentist.
The dentist commenced to dig, drill and finally fill the offending tooth.
sentences.cn: 牙医开始在那颗有问题的牙齿上挖洞，钻孔，直到最后把它补好。

sentences.en: The dentist said she would do the filling straightaway.
Think of the clammy hands you get when you visit the dentist!
sentences.cn: 想想你去看牙医时那双黏糊糊的手！

sentences.en: Visit your dentist twice a year for a checkup.
sentences.cn: 每年看两次牙医做检查。

words.tran_cn: 齿列；生齿；[脊椎] 齿系

trans.tran_en: someone whose job is to treat people’s teeth
